metadata.title: Semiconductor Critical Minerals HS Code Mapping
metadata.purpose: Map semiconductor_critical_minerals database table to specific HS codes for supply chain tracking
sources: US Geological Survey Mineral Commodity Summaries 2024

hs_codes.description: Silicon containing by weight â‰¥99.99% of silicon
hs_codes.usage: High-purity polysilicon (solar-grade 6N, needs further purification to 9-11N for semiconductors)
hs_codes.next_step: Zone refining to achieve 9-11N for semiconductor wafers

hs_codes.description: Silicon containing by weight <99.99% of silicon
hs_codes.strategic_concern: MEDIUM - China controls upstream supply

hs_codes.description: Chemical elements doped for use in electronics
hs_codes.usage: Doped silicon wafers (p-type, n-type), epitaxial silicon
hs_codes.strategic_concern: HIGH - Concentrated suppliers, essential for all chip manufacturing

mineral_hs_mappings.primary_use: GaN power devices, RF amplifiers, LEDs

hs_codes.usage: Raw gallium metal, GaN substrate production
hs_codes.substitutes: Limited - Silicon carbide (SiC) for some power applications, but not RF
hs_codes.strategic_concern: CRITICAL - Chinese monopoly, export restrictions, military applications

hs_codes.description: Gallium arsenide (GaAs), Gallium nitride (GaN) doped wafers
hs_codes.strategic_concern: MEDIUM - More diverse suppliers than raw gallium

hs_codes.usage: GaN powder for substrate growth, epitaxial layers
hs_codes.strategic_concern: HIGH - Essential for military radar, 5G

mineral_hs_mappings.primary_use: SiGe transistors, Infrared optics, Fiber optics

hs_codes.description: Germanium and articles thereof (includes germanium waste and scrap)
hs_codes.strategic_concern: HIGH - China dominance, dual-use (military infrared)
hs_codes.substitutes: Limited for infrared optics; silicon for some transistor applications

hs_codes.applications: High-frequency RF, automotive radar (77 GHz), 5G base stations
hs_codes.strategic_concern: MEDIUM - More diverse processing

hs_codes.usage: Rare earth metal ingots, refined metals
hs_codes.us_production: Mountain Pass, California (operational 2023) - only US source
hs_codes.strategic_concern: CRITICAL - Near-monopoly by China, essential for defense systems

hs_codes.substitutes: Some alternatives for polishing, but cerium most effective

hs_codes.description: Compounds of rare-earth metals, yttrium or scandium
hs_codes.usage: Neodymium compounds, dysprosium compounds, terbium compounds
hs_codes.strategic_concern: CRITICAL - China processes >90% rare earth compounds globally

hs_codes.note: Permanent magnet motors in appliances use NdFeB magnets (rare earth downstream)
hs_codes.inclusion_reason: Illustrates pervasive use of rare earth magnets in consumer electronics

hs_codes.description: Rare gases - Other (includes neon, krypton, xenon)
hs_codes.usage: Ultra-high purity neon for excimer lasers in lithography
hs_codes.supply_shock: 2022 Ukraine war disrupted 50% global supply (Ukraine/Russia 70% pre-war)
hs_codes.china_response: Rapid expansion of air separation capacity 2022-2024
hs_codes.strategic_concern: CRITICAL - Single point of failure for <7nm chip production
hs_codes.current_status: Supply stabilized (2024), but geopolitical risk remains

mineral_hs_mappings.primary_use: Plasma etching, Ion implantation, Ambient control

hs_codes.usage: Plasma etching, sputtering, inert atmosphere for crystal growth
hs_codes.supply_risk: LOW - Produced at cryogenic air separation plants worldwide
hs_codes.strategic_concern: LOW - Not supply-constrained

hs_codes.usage: Xenon: Ion implantation, etching. Krypton: Insulation, lasers
hs_codes.supply_risk: MEDIUM - More expensive, less common than argon/neon
hs_codes.strategic_concern: MEDIUM - Limited suppliers, but not critical bottleneck

hs_codes.purity_requirements: Electronic grade (99.99%+), ultra-pure for advanced nodes
hs_codes.japan_south_korea_dispute: 2019 Japan export restrictions to South Korea caused crisis
hs_codes.strategic_concern: HIGH - Japan-Korea trade dispute demonstrated vulnerability

hs_codes.description: Halides and halide oxides of non-metals (includes NF3, SF6)
hs_codes.usage: NF3: Chamber cleaning. SF6: Plasma etching, insulation
applications: NF3 replaces CF4 for CVD chamber cleaning (lower global warming)
hs_codes.environmental_concern: SF6 is most potent greenhouse gas (23,500x CO2), phase-out pressure
hs_codes.strategic_concern: MEDIUM - Multiple suppliers, but NF3 production concentrated
MEDIUM-HIGH - China processing dominance

hs_codes.usage: Tungsten metal for sputtering targets, CVD
hs_codes.semiconductor_use: Critical for sub-65nm nodes (copper interconnect barrier)
hs_codes.strategic_concern: HIGH - Essential for advanced logic, memory

hs_codes.applications: Tungsten carbide not directly used in semiconductors, but in manufacturing equipment
hs_codes.strategic_concern: MEDIUM

hs_codes.ethical_concerns: Artisanal mining with documented child labor, human rights abuses
hs_codes.china_control: Chinese companies control major DRC mines, 80% global cobalt refining
hs_codes.strategic_concern: HIGH - Geographic and processing concentration

hs_codes.description: Cobalt mattes and other intermediate products; unwrought cobalt
hs_codes.semiconductor_relevance: Cobalt barrier layers for copper interconnects at advanced nodes (<10nm)
hs_codes.battery_competition: Battery demand (EVs) competing with semiconductor demand
hs_codes.strategic_concern: CRITICAL - Dual bottleneck (mining + refining both concentrated)

hs_codes.usage: Cobalt oxide for battery cathode precursors
hs_codes.semiconductor_use: Limited direct use, but cobalt salts used in some processes

hs_codes.supply_concentration: DRC/Rwanda 50%+, but more diverse than cobalt
hs_codes.strategic_concern: MEDIUM - Conflict mineral, but more diverse sources

hs_codes.semiconductor_criticality: Tantalum capacitors used in power management ICs, high-reliability systems
hs_codes.strategic_concern: MEDIUM-HIGH - Conflict mineral, essential for miniaturized electronics

mineral_hs_mappings.primary_use: ITO (Indium Tin Oxide), Solders, Compound semiconductors

hs_codes.supply_risk: HIGH - Byproduct of zinc refining, no primary indium mines
hs_codes.strategic_concern: HIGH - No substitutes for ITO in many applications, byproduct dependency

hs_codes.description: Indium phosphide (InP), Indium gallium arsenide (InGaAs) doped
hs_codes.strategic_concern: MEDIUM-HIGH - Critical for telecom, military infrared

hs_codes.description: Unwrought hafnium (Note: May also be classified under this code with indium)
applications: High-k dielectric layers (HfO2) for sub-22nm transistors
hs_codes.criticality: CRITICAL - Essential for all advanced logic, memory <22nm
hs_codes.strategic_concern: CRITICAL - Enables Moore's Law continuation, no substitutes
hs_codes.node_dependency: Intel 45nm (2007) first commercial HfO2, now universal <22nm

hs_codes.applications: Hypersonic vehicle thermal protection (military), not semiconductors
hs_codes.note: HfO2 (hafnium oxide) for semiconductors classified under 381800 when doped/processed

sql_integration_script.description: SQL commands to add HS code columns to existing semiconductor_critical_minerals table
commands: ALTER TABLE semiconductor_critical_minerals ADD COLUMN hs_codes_primary TEXT;
ALTER TABLE semiconductor_critical_minerals ADD COLUMN hs_codes_all TEXT;
ALTER TABLE semiconductor_critical_minerals ADD COLUMN hs_code_count INTEGER;

trade_analysis_queries.description: Sample SQL queries for supply chain analysis using HS codes

examples.sql_template: SELECT reporter_country, partner_country, SUM(trade_value_usd) FROM comtrade_data WHERE commodity_code = '280450' AND reporter_country = 'CN' AND year >= 2020 GROUP BY partner_country ORDER BY SUM(trade_value_usd) DESC;

examples.query_purpose: EU dependency on China rare earths (HS 280530, 284610, 284690)
examples.sql_template: SELECT commodity_code, SUM(import_value) FROM eurostat_comext WHERE partner_country = 'CN' AND commodity_code IN ('280530', '284610', '284690') AND year = 2024 GROUP BY commodity_code;

examples.query_purpose: US imports of doped silicon wafers (HS 381800) by source country
examples.sql_template: SELECT partner_country, SUM(import_value), SUM(import_quantity_kg) FROM usitc_trade WHERE hs_code = '381800' AND reporter = 'USA' AND trade_flow = 'Import' AND year = 2024 GROUP BY partner_country;
